intro: Begonia lichenora, commonly known as the rock begonia, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
